intro: Viola amoena, commonly known as the common violet, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe, western Asia, and northern Africa. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and showy, five-petaled flowers that range in color from purple to white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its flowers bloom in early spring, and the plant is often found in woodland edges, meadows, and gardens. Viola amoena is also known for its use in traditional medicine and as a source of pigments.
